channel.title: CVE Feed for Red Hat -- Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.6 Extended Update Support
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Red Hat -- Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.6 Extended Update Support

item.title: CVE-2023-3758|2024-05-23T19:38:06.629Z -- Red Hat -- Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.6 Extended Update Support
item.description: A race condition flaw was found in sssd where the GPO policy is not consistently applied for authenticated users. This may lead to improper authorization issues, granting or denying access to resources inappropriately.

item.title: CVE-2023-4911|2024-05-23T19:33:10.799Z -- Red Hat -- Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.6 Extended Update Support
item.description: A buffer overflow was discovered in the GNU C Library's dynamic loader ld.so while processing the GLIBC_TUNABLES environment variable. This issue could allow a local attacker to use maliciously crafted GLIBC_TUNABLES environment variables when launching binaries with SUID permission to execute code with elevated privileges.

item.title: CVE-2024-3019|2024-05-23T16:35:19.453Z -- Red Hat -- Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.6 Extended Update Support
item.description: A flaw was found in PCP. The default pmproxy configuration exposes the Redis server backend to the local network, allowing remote command execution with the privileges of the Redis user. This issue can only be exploited when pmproxy is running. By default, pmproxy is not running and needs to be started manually. The pmproxy service is usually started from the 'Metrics settings' page of the Cockpit web interface. This flaw affects PCP versions 4.3.4 and newer.

item.title: CVE-2024-3019|2024-05-23T16:35:19.453Z -- Red Hat -- Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.6 Extended Update Support
item.description: A flaw was found in PCP. The default pmproxy configuration exposes the Redis server backend to the local network, allowing remote command execution with the privileges of the Redis user. This issue can only be exploited when pmproxy is running. By default, pmproxy is not running and needs to be started manually. The pmproxy service is usually started from the 'Metrics settings' page of the Cockpit web interface. This flaw affects PCP versions 4.3.4 and newer.
